<properties pageTitle="ad16d401-bb95-46a2-87df-f3cbf789d18a" writer="craigd" description="77ef6fcd-253c-4884-b704-56df126e3986" documentationCenter="xamarin" authors="lindydonna" manager="dwrede" editor="" services="mobile-services"/>
<tags ms.service="mobile-services" ms.workload="mobile" ms.tgt_pltfrm="mobile-xamarin-android" ms.devlang="dotnet" ms.topic="article" ms.date="06/09/2015" ms.author="lindydonna"/>

p.caps_html_text_node: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Android app using Azure Mobile Services. In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple
app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

div.p: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

MarkdownLinkedReference.link_id: get started with offline data sync
